business.headline: IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.
Explained: Why Manappuram Finance shares crashed 16% todayAt around 10:30 am shares of Manappuram Finance were down 16.15% to Rs 148.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty decline in early trade; Manappuram Finance tanks 15%Manappuram Finance Share Price: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 400.17 points to 80,606.44 at 10:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 96.85 points to trade at 24,653.

Hyundai IPO allotment today: Check status online; GMP shows weak listingHyundai Motor India IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.
Waaree Energies IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingWaaree Energies Limited (WEL), founded in 1990 and headquartered in Mumbai, is India's leading manufacturer and exporter of solar modules.

Hyundai IPO allotment tomorrow: Check final subscription, expected listing gainsHyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, it had been subscribed more than twice.

Wipro Q2 results: IT firm announces 1:1 bonus share issue for shareholdersWipro reported a 21% increase in net profit, reaching Rs 3,209 crore for the quarter ending in September, compared to Rs 2,646 crore in the same period last year.

Infosys declares interim dividend of Rs 21 for shareholders. Check key details Infosys interim dividend: The Bengaluru-based IT giant has set October 29, 2024, as the record date, with the payout scheduled for November 8, 2024.

Wipro Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% to Rs 3,209 croreWipro's consolidated revenue for the July-September quarter decreased by 1%, amounting to Rs 22,302 crore, down from Rs 22,543 crore in the same quarter the previous year.

Infosys Q2 results: Net profit up 5% to Rs 6,506 crore; Rs 21 dividend declaredInfosys Q2FY25 results: Revenue from operations for India's second-largest software services company also grew by 5% year-on-year, amounting to Rs 40,986 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as auto stocks drive market correctionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 494.75 points to close at 81,006.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 221.45 points to end at 24,749.85.

Sensex plunges over 500 points, Nifty below 25,000 amid market sell-offThe Sensex fell by 525.34 points, or 0.64%, at 80,976.02. Similarly, the Nifty dropped 222 points, or 0.89%, below the 25,000 mark at 24,749.30.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Supreme Court closes Isha Foundation case: Both women living there on free willWhile closing the matter, Chief Justice DY Chandrachud pulled up the Madras High Court over its orders for a police inquiry, and said proceedings cannot be used to malign people and institutions.

Terrorists kill non-local in J&K's Shopian, security forces on spotA migrant worker from Bihar was allegedly killed by terrorists in south Kashmir's Shopian district. The body of the victim was shifted to a district hospital.

PM Modi to visit Russia from October 23 to 24 for 16th Brics SummitDuring his visit, PM Modi is expected to hold bilateral meetings with his counterparts from BRICS member countries and invited leaders in Kazan.

'Nijjar video shared with CC1': Is this the intel Canada claims to have?Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, earlier this week, said his government only had 'intelligence' and not concrete proof of links between Indian agents and the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Nijjar.

How a Punjabi gangster became a cult figure for immigrant youths in CanadaBindy Johal was the first prominent Indo-Canadian in the mafia world of Canada. The Punjabi gangster's sensational rise, his flashy lifestyle, numerous encounters with women and the shattering of the South-Asian stereotype, have given him a cult status. Killed in 1998, Johal continues to attract youths to Canada's gang world.

Mass murderer Yahya Sinwar wore clothes sewn from UN food sacks as a kidHamas chief Yahya Sinwar was killed by Israeli forces on October 16.  He was the mastermind of the October 7 massacre in which Hamas terrorists killed 1,200 people in Israel. An impoverished childhood and 22 years in Israeli prisons increased Sinwar's suffering threshold.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.

Video: Yahya Sinwar, seated on sofa, threw stick at Israeli drone before deathIn the footage, Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar is seen sitting alone in a destroyed apartment in Gaza, covered in dust. He hurls a stick or plank at the approaching Israeli drone.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Noida school staffer sexually assaults girl, 3, teacher, admin cover it up Following the arrest of the main accused, the girl's class teacher and the school's security supervisor were also arrested for concealing the crime, police said.

Salman Khan begins Bigg Boss shoot amid threats: 60 guards, no one leaves until wrapAmid security threats, Salman Khan arrived for the Bigg Boss 18 shoot with enhanced security arrangements. He will be filming the Weekend Ka Vaar episodes on Friday.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Supreme Court order paves way for Gurmeet Ram Rahim's trial in sacrilege casesThe Punjab and Haryana High Court had stayed proceedings against Ram Rahim in the sacrilege cases involving the desecration of Guru Granth Sahib.
Why Maharashtra is six elections, not oneThe state comprises six regions with varied demographics, dynamics, and issues. This is what makes the upcoming polls six elections in one.

Watch: Ben Stokes loses bat, gets stumped vs Pakistan in MultanBen Stokes was involved in a bizarre dismissal during England's 4th inning chase vs Pakistan. He became Noman Ali's fifth scalp as the left-arm spinner picked up eight wickets.

Enforcement Directorate raids Muda's office in Mysuru, team of 12 officials on spotED officials are conducting a meeting with MUDA officials, including Commissioner AN Raghunandan, and are likely to seize documents in connection with the land allotment case.

Personal laws can't prevail over Child Marriage Act: Court issues guidelinesThe Supreme Court said marriages involving children violate the free will to have a life partner of choice. The top court was hearing a petition that alleged a rise in child marriages in the country.
Columbia scientists develop new bacterial cancer vaccine: How it worksResearchers from Columbia University have developed probiotic bacteria that can train the immune system to attack cancer cells.

Salman Khan gets new threat: Pay Rs 5 crore or it'll be worse than Baba Siddique'sSalman Khan gets death threat: The message, received by Mumbai Traffic Police, demanded Rs 5 crore from Salman Khan to end the enmity with Lawrence Bishnoi.

Canada's ex-NSA explains how cops changed tack in Nijjar killing probeJody Thomas, who was NSA at the time of Hardeep Singh Nijjar's murder, told the foreign interference inquiry that members of the Canadian Sikh community were not satisfied with the assessment that the killing was a tit-for-tat for Ripudaman Singh Malik's murder.

Meta fires 24 employees for using company food vouchers to buy groceriesMeta has terminated 24 employees from Los Angeles for misusing meal vouchers to purchase household items like tea, tape, detergent and more.

Ex-RAW official charged in US over plot to murder Khalistani terrorist PannunThe indictment claimed that the former Indian RAW official, along with his co-conspirator, plotted to kill Pannun in the summer of 2023 and hired an individual who demanded $100,000 for the job. The individual turned out to be an FBI informant.

Snakes & Ladders review: Uninteresting series with morally ambiguous charactersReleased-Fri Oct 18, 2024Backed by director-producer Karthik Subbaraj, Snakes & Ladders is a lacklustre show about teenagers who cover up a murder. The show raises more questions than provides answers, says our review.

Actor Upendra gives UI update: VFX work complete, can expect visual extravaganzaUpendra, director and lead actor of the Kannada film UI, has given a major update about the highly anticipated project. He said that VFX work has been completed.

All about Salman Khan's chalet on the Bigg Boss 18 setActor Salman Khan's security has been increased following death threats and the assassination of his good friend, Baba Siddiquie. The actor is currently shooting the weekend special episodes of Bigg Boss 18 and is living in his chalet.

Introverts, unite! Summer Strike is the K-drama fix you need this weekIn the latest installment of our weekly special K-fix, we revisit the serene and healing K-drama, Summer Strike, starring Kim Seol-hyun and Im Si-wan in the lead.

sports.headline: A pitch perfect plan? Aaqib Javed's video goes viral after Pakistan win 2nd TestPakistan vs England, 2nd Test: Aaqib Javed's 'formula' to win a Test match in Pakistan has gone viral after the home team fought back to win the Multan Test on Friday, October 18. Pakistan spinners picked all 20 wickets after debutant Kamran Ghulam's match-winning hundred.

Shan Masood reacts to first Test win as captain: Has come after hard timesShan Masood relished his first Test match win as a captain in Multan on Friday, October 18. Masood's Pakistan beat England by 152 runs in Multan.

Graceful Shaheen Afridi and Babar Azam congratulate Pakistan for 2nd Test victoryShaheen Afridi and Babar Azam, who were rested for the last two Tests, were graceful in congratulating the Pakistan team for their memorable win vs England. Pakistan beat England by 152 runs in the 2nd Test in Multan.

No problem with Multan pitch, Pakistan deserve credit: Brendon McCullumEngland coach Brendon McCullum claimed that he had no issues with the Multan pitch that was used for the second Test against Pakistan. The hosts won the match by 152 runs with Sajid Khan and Noman Ali picking up all 20 wickets.

'Grumpy old man' Ben Stokes apologises to teammates for frustration in 2nd TestPakistan vs England, 2nd Test: Ben Stokes conceded that his body language was not right when he lost his cool at his teammates for dropped catches in Multan. The England captain revealed he apologised to his teammates on Thursday. England lost the second Test by 152 runs.

Sajid Khan, Noman Ali break 52-year record with 20 wickets in Multan TestSajid Khan and Noman Ali scripted history as they picked up all 20 wickets in the Multan Test against England to help Pakistan win the match on October 18, Friday. Sajid and Noman had come into the side for the second Test.

Watch: Ben Stokes loses bat, gets stumped vs Pakistan in MultanBen Stokes was involved in a bizarre dismissal during England's 4th inning chase vs Pakistan. He became Noman Ali's fifth scalp as the left-arm spinner picked up eight wickets.

Pakistan snap winless home run, beat England by 152 runs in MultanSpinners Sajid Khan and Noman Ali picked up all 20 wickets to snap Pakistan's winless home run in the Tests. The duo scripted an incredible comeback to beat England in the 2nd Test match at Multan. This was Pakistan's first home Test win since February 2021.

Rohit Sharma needs MS Dhoni quality to preempt bowling changes: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has claimed that Rohit Sharma needs to add MS Dhoni's quality to preempt bowling changes to his captaincy. New Zealand have taken full control of the Bengaluru Test on Day 3 on Friday, October 18.

IND vs NZ: New Zealand break 12-year record with 299-run lead at LunchRachin Ravindra's hundred ensured that New Zealand broke a 12-year record when they took a 299-run lead against India in the Bengaluru Test on October 18, Friday. Rachin and Tim Southee tightened New Zealand's grip on the game by lunch on Day 3.

IPL Retention Live: SRH set to keep Klaasen, PBKS to rebuild once againIPL Retention Build-up Live Updates: The deadline to confirm the retentions for the IPL franchises is October 31. Watch this space as we give you the latest updates on the teams and the players they will retain.

Pakistan snap winless home run, beat England by 152 runs in MultanSpinners Sajid Khan and Noman Ali picked up all 20 wickets to snap Pakistan's winless home run in the Tests. The duo scripted an incredible comeback to beat England in the 2nd Test match at Multan. This was Pakistan's first home Test win since February 2021.

Rohit Sharma needs MS Dhoni quality to preempt bowling changes: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has claimed that Rohit Sharma needs to add MS Dhoni's quality to preempt bowling changes to his captaincy. New Zealand have taken full control of the Bengaluru Test on Day 3 on Friday, October 18.

IND vs NZ: New Zealand break 12-year record with 299-run lead at LunchRachin Ravindra's hundred ensured that New Zealand broke a 12-year record when they took a 299-run lead against India in the Bengaluru Test on October 18, Friday. Rachin and Tim Southee tightened New Zealand's grip on the game by lunch on Day 3.

IPL Retention Live: SRH set to keep Klaasen, PBKS to rebuild once againIPL Retention Build-up Live Updates: The deadline to confirm the retentions for the IPL franchises is October 31. Watch this space as we give you the latest updates on the teams and the players they will retain.

Rachin becomes 1st New Zealand batter in 12 years to score Test ton in IndiaRachin Ravindra scored his 2nd Test hundred and his very first against India on Day 3 of the 1st Test in Bengaluru. This was the first hundred by a Kiwi player in the format in the last 12 years.

Manchester United lose Kobbie Mainoo for few weeks due to muscle injuryManchester United suffered a big blow as midfielder Kobbie Mainoo has been ruled out for a few weeks due to a muscle injury. Mainoo is the latest key player for United to be on the sidelines.

Novak Djokovic vs Rafael Nadal one last dance: When and Where to watch liveNovak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal are all set for one last dance for the 3rd place match of the Six Kings Slam 2024. Find out all the live streaming details of the clash.

Al Hilal CEO slams Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman over Saudi League commentsAl Hilal CEO Esteve Calzada criticised Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman for underestimating the Saudi Pro League. Calzada's comments came after Koeman refused to select Steven Bergwijn for the Dutch side.

Carlos Alcaraz sends emotional message to Rafael Nadal after final matchCarlos Alcaraz sent an emotional message to Rafael Nadal after beating him in their final singles match on October 17, Thursday. Nadal will retire from tennis after the Davis Cup.

Tahlia feels Australia 'didn't show up' vs South Africa: Pretty hard to takeAustralia's stand-in captain Tahlia McGrath felt that Australia 'didn't show up' in their semi-final clash against South Africa in the Women's T20 World Cup 2024. She admitted that the loss was going to be hard to take.

Nadal willing to advise Alcaraz: Ready any time he wants to call meLegendary Rafael Nadal has said that he is open to advising Carlos Alcaraz in the future. Speaking at the Six Kings Slam 2024, Nadal said that he knew Alcaraz was a special talent when he saw him in 2021.

Carlos Alcaraz sends emotional message to Rafael Nadal after final matchCarlos Alcaraz sent an emotional message to Rafael Nadal after beating him in their final singles match on October 17, Thursday. Nadal will retire from tennis after the Davis Cup.

Tahlia feels Australia 'didn't show up' vs South Africa: Pretty hard to takeAustralia's stand-in captain Tahlia McGrath felt that Australia 'didn't show up' in their semi-final clash against South Africa in the Women's T20 World Cup 2024. She admitted that the loss was going to be hard to take.

Nadal willing to advise Alcaraz: Ready any time he wants to call meLegendary Rafael Nadal has said that he is open to advising Carlos Alcaraz in the future. Speaking at the Six Kings Slam 2024, Nadal said that he knew Alcaraz was a special talent when he saw him in 2021.

Injured Rishabh Pant fails to take field on Day 3, BCCI to monitor fitnessIndia vs New Zealand: Injured Rishabh Pant failed to take the field for India on Friday, October 18. Pant was injured on Day 2 of the Bengaluru Test after the ball struck him on his left knee. It was the same area where Pant had his surgery done after his road accident.

Laura Wolvaardt calls semi-final victory vs Australia as 'best win of career'Laura Wolvaardt called the semi-final victory vs Australia 'best win of her career'. South Africa stunned Australia by 8 wickets to storm into the Women's T20 World Cup 2024 final.

Aakash Chopra backs India to score 450 in 2nd innings after 46-all-out blunderIND vs NZ: Despite being 46-all-out in the first innings, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra hs backed India to score big runs in the 2nd innings. Chopra has said that India would score 400-450 runs when they next come out to bat.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
